content.body: James DiGioia (mAAdhaTTah on GH): AFAIK neither Deno nor Bun use new runtimes but piggy back off of existing ones
content.formatted_body: James DiGioia (mAAdhaTTah on GH): AFAIK neither Deno nor Bun use new runtimes but piggy back off of existing ones

content.body: For what it’s worth, XS is maintained by approximately one and a half people and follows spec proposals.

I really don’t think embeddings of V8 or JSC should “count” as extra implementations, the way XS and LibJS do. However, they have significant ecosystem impact and deserve to be considered in that way.
So, when we talk about independent implementations: yes, that has been growing! It is great
